list_definition.definition: (opposite unsociable) fond of the company of others; friendly

list_ex_of_english: The author visualises further developments in which a sociable robot would be able to learn from its experience.
She had always been very sociable but no longer felt like it and was less able.
A criminal act is a social, though generally not sociable, act occurring in a social setting and implicated in a society's cultural and structural framework.
Procedures for coding attachment, exploratory, wary, and sociable behaviors in preschool children.
One example would be the child who displayed immediate sociable behavior toward the experimenter but then showed strong wariness of her.
It is obvious that social and international relations would greatly benefit if people were happier, more reasonable and more sociable.
He was the first member of the study to reach 100 years and an extremely sociable man throughout the time that we knew him.
The authors present a new recipe for a sociable city of tomorrow with twelve building block ingredients.
